title: Classic Rotary Phones
description: Remember the satisfying click-click-click of a rotary dial? Test your knowledge!

questions.question: What was the mechanism on a rotary phone that you placed your finger in and turned to dial a number?
options: A finger wheel with numbered holes

questions.question: What sound did a rotary phone make as the dial returned to its starting position after dialing a digit?
Which number took the longest to dial on a rotary phone because the dial had to travel the farthest?
What were the letters printed next to most numbers on a rotary phone dial used for?
options: Telephone exchange names and word-based phone numbers

questions.question: What was a telephone exchange name, like 'BUtterfield 8' or 'PEnnsylvania 6-5000'?
options: A word-based prefix that corresponded to the first two digits of a phone number
A secret code for long distance

questions.question: What color was the standard rotary phone provided by the Bell Telephone Company in most American homes?
What happened if you accidentally let go of the dial before it returned all the way, or dialed a wrong number?
options: You had to hang up and start over

questions.question: What was the spiral, coiled cord that connected the handset to the base of a rotary phone called?
What model number identified the most common Western Electric rotary desk phone used in American homes from the 1950s onward?
What did people keep near their rotary phone to look up numbers before calling?
options: A Rolodex or personal phone book

questions.question: What dialing technology replaced rotary pulse dialing and used tones instead of clicks?
What was the small metal or plastic piece under the handset that disconnected the call when the phone was hung up?
On a rotary phone, what number could NOT have letters associated with it on the dial?
What thick, printed book, delivered annually to every household by the phone company, listed residential and business phone numbers?
options: The white pages and yellow pages (phone book)

questions.question: What extra-long coiled cord did teenagers stretch from the hallway phone into their bedroom for privacy?
options: An extra-long handset cord (25 feet or more)
